question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I learned more about the peer review/publication process.
2. I learned more about how to come up with a research project and the qualities I should look for in a potential mentor.
3. I learned about the services Duke offers to assist students with searching the literature.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. procedure to form a committee
2. procedure to publish a paper
3. procedure to pass the prelim

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about resources available to me in grad school but more importantly, I learned how to think about approaching different key moments in graduate school, such as forming a committee or preparing for a prelim. I learned about what to prioritize in my first year and I got a good general overview of what to expect throughout my PhD.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned a lot of useful information about how to get through graduate school. I learned how to navigate creating a relationship with my mentor and setting boundaries on how much work I am able to do and my own expectations of graduate school. In addition, I learned about necessary graduate processes such as picking a committee, prelims, and defenses.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I’ve learned a lot of information about very important things such as pre-lim, dissertation and the structure for a grant proposal.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. Expectations as a PhD student
2. Expectations for my PhD advisor
3. What actually happens in a PhD program

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to choose a PI learning skills that will help me effectively communicate with my future PI. We also discussed the basics of writing a grant and defending your thesis. Having this overview has helped me put the milestones into a new perspective.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1. I learned how to build my committee in a sustainable way that works for my needs. 
2. I gained insight that graduate students often face anxiety around similar topics and that talking about them as a group can help resolve the tension. 
3. I got introduced to the general way of how the graduate journey works, where potential ups and downs can slow down or accelerate my studies and how I can best manage those.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This was a very engaging, enjoyable, and useful class! Even with completing my MS before coming to Duke for my PhD, this class successfully furthered my development as a grad student.I learned a lot during our class opener where we shared useful tips we each picked up in the previous week (i.e. Research Rabbit, coding-trouble shooting through the library resources, etc). Additionally, Dr. Noor's lectures explaining the grant writing process and describing what all goes into formulating our dissertation/thesis were exceptionally helpful.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I have learned general things about graduate school as a first year PhD student, including but not limited to funding application, lit research, publications, the primary goals of bio PhD program, and what exactly are candidacy exams and defense.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Thinking about the future of grad school

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I appreciate Dr. Noor's candidness and honesty. The way he spoke about topics was always clear and never convoluted or dancing around the issue. I appreciated that he gave straightforward answers to questions, especially questions that are often met with deliberately vague or placating answers. I felt like he was very much on our side in terms of the advice he gave, and that he had our best interests at heart.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: He kept discussion very open and was willing to answer any question, no matter what.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor made an excellent job at facilitating discussion in the class so we can learn about different perspectives. Also, the environment created felt always such a supportive place. Moreover, I really liked how every class started, commenting what we learned in the past week that could be beneficial to the rest of the class.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I recommend this course to incoming graduate students. This class is a great resource if you have general questions related to graduate school. The class discusses a variety of topics that you may not otherwise know a lot about. These include grant writing, the peer review process, searching the literature, choosing a research project, choosing a faculty mentor, etc.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- learning about how grants and funding works (and how quickly the money gets used up)
- learning about the logistics of picking an advisor and how to communicate through rotations with potential PIs
- learning about what is important in grad school and the importance of staying yourself and not taking things too seriously

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course was great because it gives you insight from both peers and the instructor. I learned about the basics of grant writing, ways to think about choosing a lab, and overall how to navigate being a first year PhD student.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

what are the obstacles of being PhD student?
what do we need to do to make the best out of our PhD careers

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- I learned the differences between grants for funding biology/biomedical research
- I learned how to write a Sigman Xi grant and will use those skills and insights to apply for the next cycle 
- I learned qualities to look for in an advisor and what advisors are generally looking for in students; insights into communication with advisors during rotation periods was really helpful

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learnt how to work with potential supervisor, to know his style of research/teaching. I also learnt what are the important things in research for instance, to be healthy as well as work on overarching research. Moreover, I learnt how to write a research grant/proposal.

response_text: I learned how to structure a grant, how the academic review process works, how to form and communicate with a committee, and many other things.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I have learned so much about the career after getting a PhD degree. I especially enjoyed the ability of Dr.Noor to invite people with different occupations from all over the country. It is genuinely a great class! I specifically learned that 1) general pay of many jobs outside of academia could go up to 100k+, 2) Job market could be highly competitive even with a PhD degree outside of academia, and 3) Having a PhD degree could be a disadvantage as it might over qualify you as a candidate for certain jobs.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
Dr. Noor did a great job of balancing the course to be based around our feedback/interest, but still be professor driven. 
I would retain the current course components for upcoming years. Especially the lecture led by our librarian to discuss/differentiate various database resources and research tools + the Sigma Xi grant.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I recommend this course to incoming graduate students. This class is a great resource if you have general questions related to graduate school. The class discusses a variety of topics that you may not otherwise know a lot about. These include grant writing, the peer review process, searching the literature, choosing a research project, choosing a faculty mentor, etc.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- learning about how grants and funding works (and how quickly the money gets used up)
- learning about the logistics of picking an advisor and how to communicate through rotations with potential PIs
- learning about what is important in grad school and the importance of staying yourself and not taking things too seriously

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: This course was great because it gives you insight from both peers and the instructor. I learned about the basics of grant writing, ways to think about choosing a lab, and overall how to navigate being a first year PhD student.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
what are the obstacles of being PhD student?
what do we need to do to make the best out of our PhD careers
How do we write grants and how are grant recipients decided.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- I learned the differences between grants for funding biology/biomedical research
- I learned how to write a Sigman Xi grant and will use those skills and insights to apply for the next cycle 
- I learned qualities to look for in an advisor and what advisors are generally looking for in students; insights into communication with advisors during rotation periods was really helpful

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learnt how to work with potential supervisor, to know his style of research/teaching. I also learnt what are the important things in research for instance, to be healthy as well as work on overarching research. Moreover, I learnt how to write a research grant/proposal.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned how to structure a grant, how the academic review process works, how to form and communicate with a committee, and many other things.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I have learned so much about the career after getting a PhD degree. I especially enjoyed the ability of Dr.Noor to invite people with different occupations from all over the country. It is genuinely a great class! I specifically learned that 1) general pay of many jobs outside of academia could go up to 100k+, 2) Job market could be highly competitive even with a PhD degree outside of academia, and 3) Having a PhD degree could be a disadvantage as it might over qualify you as a candidate for certain jobs.
